benchmark_details.name: DemOgraphic FActualIty Repre-sentation (DoFaiR)
benchmark_details.overview: DoFaiR is a benchmark to systematically quantify the trade-off between using diversity interventions and preserving demographic factuality in Text-to-Image (T2I) models. It consists of 756 meticulously fact-checked test instances aimed at revealing the factuality tax of various diversity prompts through an automated evidence-supported evaluation pipeline.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to measure the trade-off between demographic diversity and factuality in T2I model generations.

data.source: Generated data from T2I models and fact-checked demographic information from Wikipedia.
data.annotation: Automated and systematic data construction with retrieval-based fact labeling.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparisons between the generated demographic distributions and the ground truth distributions regarding racial and gender traits.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in DDA, IDA, and IDF indicate better adherence to factual demographic distributions, whereas lower FDD indicates closer alignment to ground truth demographic diversity.
methodology.validation: Human verification confirmed high quality of collected data with an overall average factual correctness of 92.92%.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark includes both race-related and gender-related demographic assessments.
